newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Brief strike at Rotterdam BP/Texaco refinery.
newsitem.headline: Brief strike at Rotterdam BP/Texaco refinery.

text.p: Workers at Nerefco's Pernis refinery downed tools at 09.30 local time (0730 GMT) on Monday in protest at a social plan for plant closure, but were due to return to work soon, a Nerefco spokeswoman said.
"(The strike) started at 9.30 this morning, but it is due to stop within an hour," she told Reuters at 1000 GMT.
The refinery is a British Petroleum /Texaco Inc joint venture.
Last week, Nerefco workers voted down the company's redundancy plans and called for a reply from the company by noon local time on Monday, the Nerefco spokeswoman said.
The industrial action this morning, which included working-to-rule at Nerefco's other refinery, Europoort, was a wildcat strike, not organised by the unions, an FNV Industriebond spokesman said.
"Three hundred people said 'no' to the (company's) plan and some people started action by themselves this morning," the FNV spokesman said.
The spokesman said the action led to a reduction of gas oil output at Pernis and Europoort. The Nerefco spokeswoman declined to comment on the effects of the strike on output.
The company now plans to hold a meeting with union representatives on Friday at 1400 local time.
"(The workers) turned down the social plan and they will talk (with the company) at 2 pm on Friday," the Nerefco spokeswoman said.
